Bench Press.description: The bench press is a compound exercise that targets the chest muscles. Lie on a flat bench, lift the barbell, and lower it to your chest, then push it back up.

Deadlift.description: The deadlift is a powerful full-body exercise. Bend at the hips and knees to lift the barbell off the ground, then stand up straight. It targets the back, legs, and grip strength.

Squat.description: Squats are great for building leg strength. Stand with a barbell on your upper back, bend your knees, and lower your body as far as you can. Push through your heels to return to a standing position.

Pull-Ups.description: Pull-ups are an excellent bodyweight exercise for the back and arms. Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away, then pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.

Dumbbell Shoulder Press.description: Sit on a bench with back support and press dumbbells overhead. This exercise strengthens your shoulder muscles.

Lunges.description: Lunges are excellent for leg strength and balance. Step forward with one leg, bend both knees, and lower your body until both knees are at 90-degree angles.

Push-Ups.description: Push-ups are a classic bodyweight exercise for chest and triceps. Start in a plank position, lower your body by bending your elbows, and push back up.

Plank.description: The plank is an isometric core exercise. Support your body on your elbows and toes, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.

Bicep Curls.description: Bicep curls target the biceps. Hold dumbbells with your palms facing forward, bend your elbows, and lift the weights toward your shoulders.

Barbell Rows.description: Barbell rows are great for building a strong back. Bend at the hips and knees, and then pull the barbell toward your abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together.

Military Press.description: The military press is a standing barbell shoulder press. Lift the barbell from shoulder height to overhead. It targets the front and side deltoids.

Leg Raises.description: Leg raises are an effective core exercise. Lie on your back and raise your legs to a 90-degree angle, then lower them back down without letting them touch the ground.

Hammer Curls.description: Hammer curls are a variation of bicep curls that target the brachialis muscle. Hold dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and curl them.

Incline Bench Press.description: Incline bench press targets the upper chest. Lie on an inclined bench and lift the barbell, lowering it to your upper chest, and push it back up.

Lat Pulldowns.description: Lat pulldowns strengthen the back and lats. Sit at a cable machine, pull the bar down to your chest, and slowly release it back up.

Leg Press.description: The leg press machine is excellent for building leg strength. Push the weight upward with your legs, then lower it back down.

Arnold Press.description: The Arnold press is a shoulder exercise that involves rotating the dumbbells as you press them overhead. It targets all three shoulder heads.

Russian Twists.description: Russian twists involve sitting on the floor, holding a weight, and twisting your torso from side to side. It targets the obliques and core muscles.

Tricep Dips.description: Tricep dips are performed using parallel bars. Lower your body by bending your elbows and then push back up. It targets the triceps.
